reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After a long day on the road this hotel was a wonderful break. It was clean, quiet, and the beds were comfortable. The area was nice with several restaurants within walking distance which we appreciated after sitting in a car for many hours. We would definately stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: Great Break

reviews.text: I choose Hampton for the consistent quality that almost always meets their standards. This hotel fits that profile. The bathroom was shower only, which isn't a problem for me, but potential customers should be aware. I also was surprised that the rate was on the higher end for a Hampton, and this is by no means located in a tourist destination.
reviews.title: Solid Hampton Inn experience

reviews.text: Stayed at Hamption Inn for the first time.
reviews.title: Nice room, TV,microwave, fridge, internet access and all shower items that you would need.
Another consistent quality Hampton Inn
reviews.text: Greeted by Malissa :) who helped get me all registered. She was wonderful. The morning continental breakfast was more like a real breakfast that lady was also wonderful and a pleasure to talk to. The room has everything you need in it and is kept clean.

Predictable, consistent, friendly staff. Eager to correct any issues with the property. One of the few Hamptons that offers a light evening snack, that approaches a meal - nachos, homemade soups...I travel there quarterly for business.
reviews.title: Hampton Inn's
Highly Recommended
reviews.text: We are staying at the Hampton tonight. When we arrived we were greeted by Melissa at the desk, one of the most pleasant people we have encountered on our travels. We were told we could park in one of two lots. We asked if one was more secure than the other, she said no, but we could have a room overlooking our car. How accommodating! First room did not have functioning air-conditioner, called front desk, courteous Melissa said she would assign another room, and bring the key to us. We went down for the new key, in about 5 minutes she called to see if we were comfortable in the new room. How great is that in today's travel world? The room is clean and well appointed. We like the very large shower with no bath tub to step over to get into. Very nice trend for some hotels, especially for seniors and young children.

looked like anew place very nice rooms they was clean and fresh looking, like the pillowtop beds sleep great, breakfast was so so most of the stuff was cold, we got in late and ihop is right next door which was very nice didn't have to drive over all but would stay again.
reviews.title: nice place to say

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good -
reviews.title: Good Hampton Inn property.

reviews.text: Great location
reviews.title: Wonderful night stay for the Family

reviews.text: Lots of well lit parking
reviews.title: Felt new....

reviews.text: For one of the nights of our 4, the staff at Hampton Inn found us another room at a local competitor when they were completely filled. During a busy weekend in Garden City when we were on the wrong end of overbooking at another motel there, Hampton went the extra mile to find us a room on the night they could not accomodate us. Following that night we enjoyed our stay for the following nights. Very clean, nice breakfast area and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Good Business

reviews.text: The Hampton is just off the bypass on the eastern edge of Garden City, among a cluster of other motel chains and retail outlets. IHOP shares the Hampton's parking lot, and Burger King is adjacent, with other restaurants and fast-food down the main drag towards town. In this particular part of town, all the buildings seem to be built at an angle to the street, which gives a nice effect.
reviews.title: Typically excellent Hampton

reviews.text: Check in was fast and friendly. The room was large and immaculate, with fridge and microwave, flat-screen TV, effective thermostatic A/C, huge work desk, and wired Internet (cable included). All the usual Hampton bath and bedding amenities were present and correct.
reviews.title: Wonderfu

reviews.text: Not much more to say -- excellent quality and very good value. I'd definitely stay again when business brings me to western Kansas.
reviews.title: Was everything I needed.

reviews.text: My hubby and I finally found a gem of a hotel on the LAST night of our road trip vacation. Beautiful room. Great Value. If I ever come back through Garden City we will definitely stay again. Thank you Hampton!!
reviews.title: Garden City

reviews.text: Arrived the day before an unexpected snow storm for business and had to leave sooner than planned to avoid being snowed in, but the hotel and staff were AWESOME. The bed was very comfortable and the lobby area was just the right size to get work done with co-workers.
reviews.title: Chased out by the weather, but the hotel was Excellent

reviews.text: I stay here frequently for business. It is always clean and comfortable. My son accompanied me on my last trip. He loved the pool. It is a great value with free Internet and a great, free breakfast. It is close to retail stores and restaurants.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hampton Inn for two nights, slept very well, the hotel was quiet, room was clean, sheets and bedding appeared new, bed was comfortable, AC was quiet, everything worked well. All and all there were no problems, breakfast was typical and unremarkable, staff was friendly enough and attentive. It was a bit expensive but on par with the other hotel chains in Garden City. I would stay here again.
reviews.title: Comfortable stay, clean and quiet

reviews.text: Our family was very disappointed with our stay at this particular Hampton.
reviews.title: Disappointed family.

reviews.text: The hotel its self and the staff were all very accommodating, but the whole point of our stay was a fun night away from home. Which unfortunately was ruined by the fact that the pool was closed for scheduled maintenance, (which was the main reason we chose this hotel) this information would have been nice to ahead of time and we could have made other travel plan. The hotel did offer us a free pass to the local YMCA which was appreciated until we got to the YMCA which was NOT a very nice place to be (scary). For the price of the room I found this to be a very expensive night of watching tv from my bed.
reviews.title: Stay at the new Hampton Inn in Dodge City instead!
